page.title: 02East Hagbourne 1985
page.content: East Hagbourne is quite a large village which is based on farming. In the centre are old buildings, one of which has been turned into a public house and off license (Fleur de Lys). Also in the centre of the village is a small primary school with a heated indoor swimming pool. Most children at the school come from the village, Didcot and surrounding villages. In 1984 the village held raffles and jumble sales to raise money for the restoration of the church's bellcote. Restoration, started early in 1985, was completed in June. East Hagbourne has a village fete every year and there is also a pumpkin party at the Spread Eagle Pub. In the summer when extra labour is needed on the farms, children on holiday can be seen helping with the harvest.
